       Introduced  by M. of A. KOLB, GIGLIO, BARCLAY, CORWIN -- Multi-Sponsored
         by -- M. of A.   AMEDORE, BURLING,  BUTLER,  CALHOUN,  CONTE,  CROUCH,
         DUPREY,  HAWLEY,  JORDAN,  P. LOPEZ,  J. MILLER, MOLINARO, OAKS, RAIA,

       AN ACT to amend the  economic  development  law  and  the  tax  law,  in
         relation  to  establishing  the manufacturing jobs retention incentive
         program; and providing for the repeal of certain provisions upon expi-
         ration thereof

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  This act shall be known and may be cited as the "manufac-
    2  turing jobs retention incentive program".
    3    S 2. Legislative findings and  intent.    The  legislature  finds  and
    4  determines  that  historically  manufacturing firms have helped to build
    5  our state.   Today, manufacturing jobs are  an  essential  part  of  the
    6  state's  economy.    Accordingly,  the  state should offer programs that
    7  support this important sector of the state economy.  The purpose of this
    8  legislation is to establish a tax incentive program that  would  provide
    9  tax credits to manufacturing firms that retain current employment levels
   10  in the manufacturing sector over a specified period of time.
   11    S  3.  The economic development law is amended by adding a new article
   12  4-D to read as follows:
   13                                 ARTICLE 4-D
   14               MANUFACTURING JOBS RETENTION INCENTIVE PROGRAM
   15  SECTION 148. DEFINITIONS.
   16          148-A. MANUFACTURING JOBS RETENTION INCENTIVE PROGRAM.
   17          148-B. SPECIAL PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTIFIED MANUFACTURERS.
   18          148-C. REPORTING.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05152-01-1

       A. 1261                             2

    1    S 148. DEFINITIONS.  AS USED IN THIS ARTICLE, THE FOLLOWING WORDS  AND
    2  TERMS  SHALL  HAVE THE FOLLOWING MEANINGS UNLESS THE CONTENT SHALL INDI-
    3  CATE ANOTHER OR DIFFERENT MEANING OR INTENT:
    4    1.  "PROGRAM"  SHALL  MEAN  THE MANUFACTURING JOBS RETENTION INCENTIVE
    5  PROGRAM ESTABLISHED PURSUANT TO THIS ARTICLE.
    6    2. "MANUFACTURING FIRM" SHALL MEAN AN ENTERPRISE ENGAGED IN THE  BUSI-
    7  NESS OF PRODUCTION OF GOODS AND PRODUCTS FROM RAW MATERIALS.
    8    3. "MJRI" SHALL MEAN MANUFACTURING JOBS RETENTION INCENTIVE.
    9    S  148-A.  MANUFACTURING JOBS RETENTION INCENTIVE PROGRAM. 1. THERE IS
   10  HEREBY CREATED A MANUFACTURING JOBS RETENTION INCENTIVE  PROGRAM  WITHIN
   11  THE DEPARTMENT TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL AND FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM
   12  OF  TAX  INCENTIVES  TO  MANUFACTURING  FIRMS  THAT RETAIN THEIR CURRENT
   13  LEVELS OF EMPLOYMENT OVER A PERIOD OF TEN YEARS.
   14    2. THE  COMMISSIONER  SHALL  DETERMINE  ELIGIBILITY  REQUIREMENTS  FOR
   15  PARTICIPATION  IN THE PROGRAM, PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT SUCH REQUIREMENTS
   16  INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING:
   17    (A) AN APPLICANT SHALL HAVE MAINTAINED OFFICES WITHIN THE STATE FOR AT
   18  LEAST FIVE YEARS PRIOR TO APPLICATION FOR PARTICIPATION IN THE PROGRAM;
   19    (B) AN APPLICANT MAY NOT PARTICIPATE IN THE PROGRAM IF DESIGNATED AS A
   20  CERTIFIED BUSINESS LOCATED IN AN EMPIRE ZONE CREATED PURSUANT TO ARTICLE
   21  EIGHTEEN-B OF THE GENERAL MUNICIPAL LAW;
   22    (C) AN APPLICANT THAT HAS PREVIOUSLY PARTICIPATED IN THE  PROGRAM  MAY
   23  REAPPLY  FOR PARTICIPATION IN THE PROGRAM, PROVIDED THAT IF AN APPLICANT
   24  HAS HAD THEIR PARTICIPATION IN THE PROGRAM  TERMINATED  FOR  FAILURE  TO
   25  MEET  THE  RETENTION  REQUIREMENTS  THE  APPLICANT MAY NOT REAPPLY FOR A
   26  PERIOD OF FIVE YEARS; AND
   27    (D) AN APPLICANT MUST EMPLOY AT LEAST TEN EMPLOYEES.
   28    3. APPLICATIONS FOR PARTICIPATION IN THE MANUFACTURING JOBS  RETENTION
   29  INCENTIVE  PROGRAM  SHALL  BE  IN THE FORM AND CONTAIN SUCH INFORMATION,
   30  EXHIBITS AND SUPPORTING DATA AS THE COMMISSIONER MAY PRESCRIBE.
   31    4. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL REVIEW ALL APPLICATIONS FOR PARTICIPATION IN
   32  THE PROGRAM FOR ELIGIBILITY AND SHALL REGISTER THE EMPLOYMENT LEVELS  OF
   33  ELIGIBLE  APPLICANTS.  EACH YEAR, EACH REGISTERED APPLICANT SHALL SUBMIT
   34  TO THE COMMISSIONER AN ANNUAL REGISTRATION STATEMENT, TOGETHER WITH SUCH
   35  INFORMATION, EXHIBITS  AND  SUPPORTING  DATA  AS  THE  COMMISSIONER  MAY
   36  REQUIRE.  THE  COMMISSIONER SHALL REVIEW THE REGISTERED APPLICANT'S FILE
   37  FOR CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY FOR THE  TAX  INCENTIVES.  IF  THE  REGISTERED
   38  APPLICANT  HAS  MAINTAINED ITS INITIAL LEVELS OF EMPLOYMENT, THE COMMIS-
   39  SIONER SHALL PROVIDE A CERTIFICATE FOR THE TAXABLE YEARS THAT THE APPLI-
   40  CANT IS ELIGIBLE FOR THE TAX CREDITS PURSUANT TO THIS ARTICLE.
   41    S 148-B.  SPECIAL PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTIFIED  MANUFACTURERS.  1.
   42  DURING  THE  CERTIFICATION  PERIOD, THE PARTICIPATING MANUFACTURING FIRM
   43  SHALL RECEIVE THE FOLLOWING TAX CREDITS:
   44    (A) FOR THE MJRI PROPERTY TAX CREDIT, THE TAX CREDIT SHALL BE COMPUTED
   45  PURSUANT TO SECTION TWENTY-FOUR-A OF THE TAX LAW;
   46    (B) FOR THE MJRI WAGE CREDIT, THE TAX CREDIT SHALL BE COMPUTED  PURSU-
   47  ANT TO SECTION TWENTY-FOUR-B OF THE TAX LAW; AND
   48    (C)  FOR  THE  MJRI  ENERGY  CREDIT,  THE TAX CREDIT SHALL BE COMPUTED
   49  PURSUANT TO SECTION TWENTY-FOUR-C OF THE TAX LAW.
   50    2. AN APPLICANT SHALL RECEIVE TWENTY-FIVE  PERCENT  OF  THE  AVAILABLE
   51  CREDITS FOR EACH OF THE FIRST FIVE YEARS OF PARTICIPATION, FIFTY PERCENT
   52  OF  THE  AVAILABLE  CREDITS  FOR  THE  NEXT  THREE YEARS AND ONE HUNDRED
   53  PERCENT OF THE AVAILABLE CREDITS FOR THE  FINAL  TWO  YEARS  OF  PARTIC-
   54  IPATION.    PARTICIPANTS  MUST  QUALIFY  IN EVERY YEAR OF THE PROGRAM TO
   55  RECEIVE CREDITS.

    1    S 148-C. REPORTING. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL,  ON  OR  BEFORE  SEPTEMBER
    2  FIRST,  TWO THOUSAND TWELVE, AND ANNUALLY THEREAFTER, SUBMIT A REPORT TO
    3  THE GOVERNOR, THE TEMPORARY PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE, THE SPEAKER OF  THE
    4  ASSEMBLY  AND THE MINORITY LEADERS OF THE SENATE AND THE ASSEMBLY ON THE
    5  OPERATION  AND  ACCOMPLISHMENTS  OF THE PROGRAM PROVIDED FOR PURSUANT TO
    6  THIS ARTICLE.
    7    S 4. The tax law is amended by adding three new  sections  24-a,  24-b
    8  and 24-c to read as follows:
    9    S  24-A. MJRI PROPERTY TAX CREDIT. (A) ALLOWANCE OF CREDIT. A TAXPAYER
   10  WHICH HAS RECEIVED AN MJRI CERTIFICATE FOR  THE  TAXABLE  YEAR,  AND  IS
   11  SUBJECT  TO TAX UNDER ARTICLE NINE-A OR TWENTY-TWO OF THIS CHAPTER SHALL
   12  BE ALLOWED A CREDIT AGAINST SUCH TAX, PURSUANT TO THE PROVISIONS  REFER-
   13  ENCED  IN SUBDIVISION (D) OF THIS SECTION, TO BE COMPUTED AS HEREINAFTER
   14  SPECIFIED.
   15    (B) DEFINITION. THE TERM "ELIGIBLE REAL  PROPERTY  TAXES"  SHALL  MEAN
   16  TAXES IMPOSED ON REAL PROPERTY WHICH HAS BEEN CERTIFIED AS MJRI PROPERTY
   17  PURSUANT TO ARTICLE FOUR-D OF THE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT LAW. IN ADDITION,
   18  THE  TERM  "ELIGIBLE  REAL  PROPERTY TAXES" INCLUDES PAYMENTS IN LIEU OF
   19  TAXES MADE BY THE TAXPAYER TO THE STATE, A MUNICIPAL  CORPORATION  OR  A
   20  PUBLIC  BENEFIT CORPORATION PURSUANT TO A WRITTEN AGREEMENT ENTERED INTO
   21  BY THE TAXPAYER AND THE STATE, MUNICIPAL CORPORATION OR  PUBLIC  BENEFIT
   22  CORPORATION.
   23    (C)  APPLICATION  OF  THE CREDIT. THE AMOUNT OF THE CREDIT SHALL EQUAL
   24  THE PRODUCT (OR PRO RATA SHARE OF THE PRODUCT, IN THE CASE OF  A  MEMBER
   25  OF A PARTNERSHIP) OF TEN PERCENT AND THE ELIGIBLE REAL PROPERTY TAXES.
   26    (D)  CROSS-REFERENCES.  FOR  APPLICATION OF THE CREDIT PROVIDED FOR IN
   27  THIS SUBDIVISION, SEE THE FOLLOWING PROVISIONS OF THIS CHAPTER:
   28    (1) ARTICLE 9-A: SECTION 210: SUBDIVISION 43,
   29    (2) ARTICLE 22: SECTION 606: SUBSECTION (SS).
   30    S 24-B. MJRI WAGE CREDIT. (A) ALLOWANCE OF CREDIT.  A  TAXPAYER  WHICH
   31  HAS RECEIVED AN MJRI CERTIFICATE FOR THE TAXABLE YEAR, AND IS SUBJECT TO
   32  TAX  UNDER ARTICLE NINE-A OR TWENTY-TWO OF THIS CHAPTER SHALL BE ALLOWED
   33  A CREDIT AGAINST SUCH TAX, PURSUANT  TO  THE  PROVISIONS  REFERENCED  IN
   34  SUBDIVISION  (D)  OF  THIS SECTION, TO BE COMPUTED AS HEREINAFTER SPECI-
   35  FIED.
   36    (B) DEFINITION. THE TERM "ELIGIBLE WAGES" SHALL MEAN GROSS WAGES  PAID
   37  TO EMPLOYEES WHO HAVE BEEN CERTIFIED AS MJRI EMPLOYEES PURSUANT TO ARTI-
   38  CLE FOUR-D OF THE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT LAW.
   39    (C)  APPLICATION  OF  THE CREDIT. THE AMOUNT OF THE CREDIT SHALL EQUAL
   40  THE PRODUCT (OR PRO RATA SHARE OF THE PRODUCT, IN THE CASE OF  A  MEMBER
   41  OF A PARTNERSHIP) OF ONE PERCENT AND THE ELIGIBLE WAGES.
   42    (D)  CROSS-REFERENCES.  FOR  APPLICATION OF THE CREDIT PROVIDED FOR IN
   43  THIS SUBDIVISION, SEE THE FOLLOWING PROVISIONS OF THIS CHAPTER:
   44    (1) ARTICLE 9-A: SECTION 210: SUBDIVISION 44,
   45    (2) ARTICLE 22: SECTION 606: SUBSECTION (TT).
   46    S 24-C. MJRI ENERGY CREDIT. (A) ALLOWANCE OF CREDIT. A TAXPAYER  WHICH
   47  HAS RECEIVED AN MJRI CERTIFICATE FOR THE TAXABLE YEAR, AND IS SUBJECT TO
   48  TAX  UNDER ARTICLE NINE-A OR TWENTY-TWO OF THIS CHAPTER SHALL BE ALLOWED
   49  A CREDIT AGAINST SUCH TAX, PURSUANT  TO  THE  PROVISIONS  REFERENCED  IN
   50  SUBDIVISION  (E)  OF  THIS SECTION, TO BE COMPUTED AS HEREINAFTER SPECI-
   51  FIED.
   52    (B) DEFINITION. THE TERM "ELIGIBLE ENERGY COSTS" SHALL MEAN  THE  COST
   53  OF  ELECTRICITY,  NATURAL  GAS,  OR  ANY OTHER ENERGY PRODUCT OR SERVICE
   54  WHICH THE TAXPAYER HAS USED AS PART OF THE OPERATION OF AN  MJRI  CERTI-
   55  FIED  FACILITY  PURSUANT  TO  ARTICLE FOUR-D OF THE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT
   56  LAW.

    1    (C) THE LIMITATION SHALL BE THE  PRODUCT  OF  FIFTY  DOLLARS  AND  THE
    2  NUMBER  OF  EMPLOYEES  CERTIFIED  AS  MJRI EMPLOYEES PURSUANT TO ARTICLE
    3  FOUR-D OF THE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT LAW.
    4    (D)  APPLICATION  OF  THE CREDIT. THE AMOUNT OF THE CREDIT SHALL EQUAL
    5  THE PRODUCT (OR PRO RATA SHARE OF THE PRODUCT, IN THE CASE OF  A  MEMBER
    6  OF A PARTNERSHIP) OF ONE HUNDRED PERCENT AND THE ELIGIBLE ENERGY COSTS.
    7    (E)  CROSS-REFERENCES.  FOR  APPLICATION OF THE CREDIT PROVIDED FOR IN
    8  THIS SUBDIVISION, SEE THE FOLLOWING PROVISIONS OF THIS CHAPTER:
    9    (1) ARTICLE 9-A: SECTION 210: SUBDIVISION 45,
   10    (2) ARTICLE 22: SECTION 606: SUBSECTION (UU).

   18    (B)  CARRYOVERS.  THE  CREDIT  ALLOWED  UNDER THIS SUBDIVISION FOR ANY

   26    44. MJRI WAGE CREDIT. (A) ALLOWANCE OF CREDIT.  A  TAXPAYER  SHALL  BE

   28  ADDED BY CHAPTER SIX HUNDRED EIGHTY-SIX OF  THE  LAWS  OF  TWO  THOUSAND

   30    (B)  CARRYOVERS.  THE  CREDIT  ALLOWED  UNDER THIS SUBDIVISION FOR ANY

   32  HIGHER OF THE AMOUNTS PRESCRIBED IN PARAGRAPHS (C) AND (D)  OF  SUBDIVI-
   33  SION ONE OF THIS SECTION. PROVIDED, HOWEVER, IF THE AMOUNT OF THIS CRED-
   34  IT ALLOWABLE UNDER THIS SECTION FOR ANY TAXABLE YEAR REDUCES TAX TO SUCH
   35  AMOUNT, ANY AMOUNT OF THE CREDIT NOT DEDUCTIBLE IN SUCH TAXABLE YEAR MAY
   36  BE  CARRIED OVER TO THE FOLLOWING YEAR OR YEARS AND MAY BE DEDUCTED FROM
   37  THE TAXPAYER'S TAX FOR SUCH YEAR OR YEARS.
   38    45. MJRI ENERGY CREDIT. (A) ALLOWANCE OF CREDIT. A TAXPAYER  SHALL  BE
   39  ALLOWED  A  CREDIT, TO BE COMPUTED AS PROVIDED IN SECTION TWENTY-ONE, AS
   40  ADDED BY CHAPTER SIX HUNDRED EIGHTY-SIX OF  THE  LAWS  OF  TWO  THOUSAND
   41  THREE, OF THIS CHAPTER, AGAINST THE TAX IMPOSED BY THIS ARTICLE.
   42    (B)  CARRYOVERS.  THE  CREDIT  ALLOWED  UNDER THIS SUBDIVISION FOR ANY
   43  TAXABLE YEAR SHALL NOT REDUCE THE TAX DUE FOR SUCH YEAR TO LESS THAN THE
   44  HIGHER OF THE AMOUNTS PRESCRIBED IN PARAGRAPHS (C) AND (D)  OF  SUBDIVI-
   45  SION ONE OF THIS SECTION. PROVIDED, HOWEVER, IF THE AMOUNT OF THIS CRED-
   46  IT ALLOWABLE UNDER THIS SECTION FOR ANY TAXABLE YEAR REDUCES TAX TO SUCH
   47  AMOUNT, ANY AMOUNT OF THE CREDIT NOT DEDUCTIBLE IN SUCH TAXABLE YEAR MAY
   48  BE  CARRIED OVER TO THE FOLLOWING YEAR OR YEARS AND MAY BE DEDUCTED FROM
   49  THE TAXPAYER'S TAX FOR SUCH YEAR OR YEARS.

   10    S  7.  Section  606  of  the  tax  law  is amended by adding three new
   11  subsections (ss), (tt) and (uu) to read as follows:
   12    (SS) MJRI PROPERTY TAX CREDIT. (1) ALLOWANCE  OF  CREDIT.  A  TAXPAYER
   13  SHALL  BE  ALLOWED A CREDIT, TO BE COMPUTED AS PROVIDED IN SECTION TWEN-
   14  TY-ONE, AS ADDED BY CHAPTER SIX HUNDRED EIGHTY-SIX OF THE  LAWS  OF  TWO
   15  THOUSAND  THREE,  OF THIS CHAPTER, AGAINST THE TAX IMPOSED BY THIS ARTI-

   17    (2) APPLICATION OF CREDIT. IF THE AMOUNT OF THE CREDIT  ALLOWED  UNDER

   19  SUCH  YEAR,  THE  EXCESS SHALL BE TREATED AS AN OVERPAYMENT OF TAX TO BE

   22  SHALL BE PAID THEREON.
   23    (TT) MJRI WAGE CREDIT. (1) ALLOWANCE OF CREDIT. A  TAXPAYER  SHALL  BE
   24  ALLOWED  A  CREDIT, TO BE COMPUTED AS PROVIDED IN SECTION TWENTY-ONE, AS
   25  ADDED BY CHAPTER SIX HUNDRED EIGHTY-SIX OF  THE  LAWS  OF  TWO  THOUSAND
   26  THREE, OF THIS CHAPTER, AGAINST THE TAX IMPOSED BY THIS ARTICLE.
   27    (2)  APPLICATION OF CREDIT.  IF THE AMOUNT OF THE CREDIT ALLOWED UNDER

   29  SUCH YEAR, THE EXCESS SHALL BE TREATED AS AN OVERPAYMENT OF  TAX  TO  BE
   30  CREDITED  OR  REFUNDED  IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION SIX
   31  HUNDRED EIGHTY-SIX OF THIS ARTICLE, PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT NO  INTEREST
   32  SHALL BE PAID THEREON.
   33    (UU)  MJRI ENERGY CREDIT. (1) ALLOWANCE OF CREDIT. A TAXPAYER SHALL BE
   34  ALLOWED A CREDIT, TO BE COMPUTED AS PROVIDED IN SECTION  TWENTY-ONE,  AS
   35  ADDED  BY  CHAPTER  SIX  HUNDRED  EIGHTY-SIX OF THE LAWS OF TWO THOUSAND
   36  THREE, OF THIS CHAPTER, AGAINST THE TAX IMPOSED BY THIS ARTICLE.
   37    (2) APPLICATION OF CREDIT.  IF THE AMOUNT OF THE CREDIT ALLOWED  UNDER
   38  THIS SUBSECTION FOR ANY TAXABLE YEAR SHALL EXCEED THE TAXPAYER'S TAX FOR
   39  SUCH  YEAR,  THE  EXCESS SHALL BE TREATED AS AN OVERPAYMENT OF TAX TO BE
   40  CREDITED OR REFUNDED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS  OF  SECTION  SIX
   41  HUNDRED  EIGHTY-SIX OF THIS ARTICLE, PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT NO INTEREST
   42  SHALL BE PAID THEREON.
   43    S 8. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
   44  it shall have become a law and shall apply to taxable years beginning on
   45  or after January 1, 2012 and before January 1, 2021; provided,  however,
   46  that  the  addition,  amendment  and/or repeal of any rule or regulation
   47  necessary for the implementation of this act on its effective  date  are
   48  authorized and directed to be made on or before such date; and provided,
   49  further  that  the  MJRI  property  tax  credit under subsection (ss) of
   50  section 606 of the tax law contained in section seven of this act  shall
   51  expire on December 31, 2012.
